title: Introducing: Kellen Malloy
content:
With two tracks online, clocking in at fifteen minutes in length between them, it’s fair to say that Kellen Malloy isn’t in the market for writing pop hits for star-eyed teenagers.

Ocotillo I (Manic Route) and Ocotillo II (Nite Fell) are taken from his upcoming debut LP Iso, and paint a starkly intimidating yet wondrously beautiful picture. From the scarcely audible, muttered vocals to the industrial clanks and eerie scratches, there’s something vaguely detached about Malloy, as he builds soundscapes that place themselves somewhere between the ambient ponderings of Tim Hecker and the perfectly intertwined faux-sonnets of Radiohead.  in the early hour the changes come and i told you to be careful of. 
this brain it runs fast and far. trip on bleeding eye. 

i’m beginning to numb, need to hide. to the end and back i’m 
beginning to find this fear is just one lonely night.

With another eight tracks set to complete the release of Iso, this LA upstart is certainly one to keep an eye out for.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
